--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, Colin Green <cgreen@d...> wrote:

> Hi Kennon, Arjun,
> 
> Entirely coincental but I happen to be from Birmingham - or nearby
now 
> anyhow. Yeh, I was aware that there is an AI group there (Natural 
> Computation is a much nicer term), though I've never had any
contact 
> with anyone in the group -  it does seem to have developed quite a
bit 
> since I last checked it out. Xin Yao's 1999 paper "Evolving
Artificial 
> Neural Networks" was really the catalyst for me to have a go at an
EANN 
> project instead of just thinking about it. Currently that means 
> developing my own version of NEAT in C# which I'm keen to try
against a 
> range of domains to get a feel for myself  just what NEAT (and
similar 
> techniques) are capable of and what their limits are.
> 
> Anyway it's interesting you guys are on this list. Are you or are
any of 
> your colleagues actually working with NEAT? or are you just
lurking? :)
> 
> Perhaps I'll catch you off list since this is potentially straying 
> off-topic somewhat.
> 
> Colin.

Hi Colin,

No need to go off-list on this topic..I'd be interested too.  One
connection you also may not know of is that Kennon was an undergrad
here at UT and did an independent study with me working on NEAT a
couple years ago. 

It's definitely interesting to know what the biggest researchers in
neuroevolution are up to, since there really aren't that many major
places to study this topic (yet).  

ken
